data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 9 steps right backwards. Turn around and take 9 steps left forwards.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around after taking 4 steps. At one point, you turn right and make a left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is no start point in the instructions. If you turn around the instructions say you are returning to the starting point, the number of steps it takes are 4. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 1 step then take 7 steps. Then take one step again. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 5 steps.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn away from your starting point, you are going to turn back to your starting point. Turning around takes 7 steps, so you are going to take 7 steps back and turn around once again. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 8 steps for a return to the first point. Take 9 steps for a return to the first point. In both actions you are returning to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you take 6 steps for 2 steps back you will get back to take 4 steps. Let’ s also assume you are not going back to take 1 step but instead 2, 3 and 4 so take 2. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the directions, you always face forward. Take 1 step left, make it 1 step right and take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is the first step. This is the third step. You can only take 7 steps at a time. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step backward does not return you back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You walk backward by following the instructions to the left. You do not look forward. If you take 6 steps backwards, you can run backwards. If you take 8 steps right, you can run backwards. If you take 5 steps left, you can run left. If you walk backwards, you can turn around, find your way forward. If you walk in any direction, you find your way left. If you always face forward, you always return to. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always move to the forward position. The starting point has 9 steps left and 10 steps left. Whenever you move to the left, you move to the right. The starting point in the set of instructions is always facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Once you start facing forward, you are facing forward. If you face right, you are facing left. If you face left, you are facing right. Taking 3 steps right requires you to step 3 inches to your right and take 3 inches back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward you would take 3 steps right and this keeps you facing forward in the beginning. If you take 6 steps left then you should take 1 step forward to begin taking steps in the right direction. If you always face forward you would take 3 steps right and this keeps you facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You do not return to a beginning point if you have lost 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 steps. This is repeated on the second round. Take 10 steps. This is repeated on the second round. Take 10 steps. This is repeated on the third round. Take 6 steps. This is repeated on the fourth round. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are going backwards, you halt at the starting point. If you are going towards the starting point, you halt at the starting point and take 1 step. If you are going toward the starting point, you halt at the starting point and take 2 steps. If you are going towards the starting point, you halt at the starting point and take 7 steps. If you are turning left, you turn right at the beginning of the turn. So, the answer is No.

Turn right on 1st step is 1. Take 5 steps back then turn right. So, the answer is No.

To return to the starting point you would take 6 steps. The answer: Yes.

When you turn around you return to the starting point. If you repeat 3 moves all the way you can stop taking steps and just continue walking. So, the answer is No.

You turn around and take 3 steps. You take 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It says that to go forward, you take 7 steps left and 7 steps right. If you’re always facing forward, it says you begin with a straight line and always face forward. If you’re always facing backward; you take 2 steps right, which is backward and not forward. In short, you take 5 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If a person always faces forward, then every time they step, that person returns to the starting point. If then they look right, they will always go backward. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and return to the starting place will take 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Your starting point must always face forward. In order to return you must take the 6 steps you took right in the beginning. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You are looking straight at something in the above instructions but you do not necessarily end up returning to that place. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For a move to go forward you need to always face forward and if you are going to take 8 steps forward you need to start by facing forward. So, the answer is No.

No actions take more steps than taking one step. You can only take 1 step at a time. So, the answer is No.

No turn around when you are already on the first 9 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you take the first 4 steps forward and 5 of them are backward, you will only have left, right, and center, leaving only the forward steps. You can only make your way back, which means you need to take the last four steps forward and the last 3 of them backward. If you always face forward in the instructions, you would still return to the starting point of facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

A person can take 4 steps within the first 8 steps. The first time a person takes 7 steps they’ll turn around and go back to the begining point. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, the one thing you cannot take back is going forward. If you take 4 steps backward, you can take 4 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

The starting points are facing forward always. Taking 5 steps left and going backward is the same as taking 4 steps right and going backward. Taking the same number of steps all the way to the starting point is also the same as making a right turn. The starting points are facing forward always. So, the answer is Yes.

The order of steps for this equation is: 1 - 3 - 1 / 3 = 2 - 1 / 3 = 2 / 4 The order of steps is the same for the different steps in the equation. So, the answer is yes.

Assigning directions is something like facing forward. Reversing instructions changes the direction of direction. The direction of the step changes. It is not possible back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The instructions will return you to your original position. To start forward. It is also stated in the instructions that your first direction is forward.
